citation.article-title: Sphingobium wenxiniae sp. nov., a synthetic pyrethroid (SP)-degrading bacterium isolated from activated sludge in an SP-manufacturing wastewater treatment facility
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Sphingobium wenxiniae sp. nov.

Sphingobium wenxiniae (wen.xin′i.ae. N.L. fem. gen. n. wenxin of Wen-xin, to honour Wen-xin Chen, a respected soil microbiologist, for her great contributions to the investigation and development of rhizobia resources in China).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-spore-forming, non-motile and rod-shaped (0.5–0.6×0.7–1.0 µm).
Colonies on LB agar are circular, opaque, yellow and convex with entire margins.
Grows in 0–4 % (w/v) NaCl (optimum 1 %), at pH 6–9 (optimum pH 7–8) and at 15–40 °C (optimum 28–30 °C).

Positive for catalase, glucose acidification and assimilation of malate and caprate but negative for oxidase, urease, arginine dihydrolase and β-galactosidase activities, nitrate reduction, indole reaction, Voges–Proskauer reaction, methyl red test, hydrolysis of aesculin, gelatin and starch and assimilation of d-glucose, l-arabinose, d-mannose, maltose, citrate, mannitol, gluconate, phenylacetic acid, adipate and N-acetylglucosamine.

In the Biolog GN2 system, the following compounds are oxidized: methyl pyruvate, sebacic acid, Tween 40, β-hydroxyl butyric acid, α-keto butyric acid, α-keto valeric acid, glycyl-l-aspartic acid and glycyl-l-glutamic acid.
The major cellular fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c, C19 : 0 cyclo ω8c, C14 : 0 2-OH, 11 methyl C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.
The polar lipids are DPG, PG, PC, PE, SGL and two unidentified PL.
The major cellular polyamine is spermidine.
The type strain, JZ-1T ( = CGMCC 1.7748T = DSM 21828T), was isolated from activated sludge from Yangnong Chemical Group, an SP-manufacturing wastewater treatment facility in Jiangsu Province, China.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64.2 mol%.
